org.firmata4j.ssd1306

Class SSD1306MessageFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firmata4j.ssd1306.SSD1306MessageFactory

  • public class SSD1306MessageFactory
extends Object
    This class contains methods that help to build command messages for SSD1306 device.
    Author:
    Oleg Kurbatov <o.v.kurbatov@gmail.com> see https://cdn-shop.adafruit.com/datasheets/SSD1306.pdf

      • setVerticalScrollArea

        public static byte[] setVerticalScrollArea(byte fixedRows,
                                           byte scrolledRows)
        Sets vertical scroll area.

        For 64-row display:

        • fixedRows = 0, scrolledRows : whole area scrolls
        • fixedRows = 0, scrolledRows < 64 : top area scrolls
        • fixedRows + scrolledRows < 64 : central area scrolls
        • fixedRows + scrolledRows = 64 : bottom area scrolls

        Note that:

        • fixedRows + scrolledRows <= setMultiplexRatio(int)
        • scrolledRows <= setMultiplexRatio(int)
        • verticalOffset from setVerticalAndHorizontalScroll(org.firmata4j.ssd1306.SSD1306MessageFactory.ScrollDirection, byte, byte, byte, byte) <= scrolledRows
        • setDisplayStartLine(int) <= scrolledRows

        Parameters:
        fixedRows - No. of rows in top fixed area. It is referenced to the top of the GDDRAM.
        scrolledRows - No. of rows in scroll area. This is the number of rows to be used for vertical scrolling. The scroll area starts in the first row below the top fixed area.
        Returns:
        command sequence

      • setMemoryAddressingMode

        public static byte[] setMemoryAddressingMode(SSD1306MessageFactory.MemoryAddressingMode mode)

      • setColumnAddress

        public static byte[] setColumnAddress(byte startAddress,
                                      byte endAddress)
        Setup column start and end address.
        This command is only for horizontal or vertical addressing mode.
        Parameters:
        startAddress - Column start address, range : 0-127
        endAddress - Column end address, range : 0-127
        Returns:
        command sequence

      • setPageAddress

        public static byte[] setPageAddress(byte startAddress,
                                    byte endAddress)
        Setup page start and end address.
        This command is only for horizontal or vertical addressing mode.
        Parameters:
        startAddress - Page start Address, range : 0-7
        endAddress - Page end Address, range : 0-7
        Returns:
        command sequence

      • setLowerColumnStartAddress

        public static byte[] setLowerColumnStartAddress(byte address)
        Set the lower nibble of the column start address register for Page Addressing Mode. The initial display line register is reset to 0 after RESET.
        This command is only for page addressing mode.
        Parameters:
        address - lower nibble of the column start address
        Returns:
        command sequence

      • setHigherColumnStartAddress

        public static byte[] setHigherColumnStartAddress(byte address)
        Set the higher nibble of the column start address register for Page Addressing Mode. The initial display line register is reset to 0 after RESET.
        This command is only for page addressing mode.
        Parameters:
        address - higher nibble of the column start address
        Returns:
        command sequence

      • setRAMPageStartAddress

        public static byte[] setRAMPageStartAddress(byte address)
        Set GDDRAM Page Start Address (PAGE0~PAGE7) for Page Addressing Mode.
        This command is only for page addressing mode.
        Parameters:
        address - Page start Address, range : 0-7
        Returns:
        command sequence
